meanings.sent1: After the chaos, they had to reimpose order in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The teacher decided to reimpose the rule of raising hands before speaking.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled as the teacher threatened to reimpose the 'no talking' rule.
meanings.sent4: The principal had to reimpose discipline like a captain restoring order on a ship.
meanings.sent5: The idea of reimposing silence made the students uneasy.

meanings.sent1: The government had to reimpose the curfew to maintain safety.
meanings.sent2: The police were ready to reimpose the law in the rioting area.
meanings.sent3: The kids groaned when their parents threatened to reimpose the bedtime rule.
meanings.sent4: The referee had to reimpose the rules of the game to ensure fair play.
meanings.sent5: The thought of reimposing restrictions made the citizens anxious.
